main event: A civilian reported observing an unidentified flying object in Mt. Vernon, New York during the summer of 1953.
interesting points: The object was observed for 3 seconds moving from left to right,The observation was made around 5 PM,The witness claimed it could not be Saturn, providing four incorrect reasons,No photographs or physical evidence were collected,The report has been re-evaluated in 1965 but lacks additional solid evidence.
witness description: A civilian expressing conviction that the sighting was of extraterrestrial origin.
